This is by far, the best pizza in the Bronx!!!

A first for me and already it's legendary in my book. Good service surpassed by it's food. Sal could of treated my like I was the  crumbs that are currently scattered throughout my beard looking for refuge after they were pillaged and children were eaten.. So if you're looking for delicious, authentic New York pizza that bears the responsibility of living up it's name and won't let some fugazi come into town and give disrespect, then Pugsley' is the spot to get what you came for. Delizosio!
If I have to go to/ through the Bronx .. I'm stopping!
Favorite place to eat, great atmosphere, great food and great people.
The best.....
The owners here are friendly and very talkative. I was surprised to see how engaged they were with me asking questions about myself as well as how I would like my pizza. That's a rarity!
Chicken roll

Red Flag in the time of COVID I had to ask the cook to put on a mask... that's definitely a NO NO. Pizza was mediocre. I could have passed and went to Lil Cesar instead.

I've always loved this place. Feels like being in someone's home. And in this case, someone's backyard. I called in my order on my way there and although there were a line of customers, I had no problem finding a seat to myself. The staff were also friendly as always.
(Translated by Google) Will !!!  (Original) Sal!!!

When I say this place does not give a fry lol wow what a night 🤯 I hope they dont always take your money 1st then call you back and say "naw the delivery doesn't feel like making that 10min ride but we'll refund you in 24hr so forget that you won't be able to eat tonight, it's nothing we can do.??

It's so refreshing to finally find a place that has trained and showed all of it's employees that it's important to be happy and greet all customers and make them feel welcome and at home. Food is excellent, atmosphere is great and owners and employees are very happy and friendly. More places in this world should take a lesson from this place.
Awesome!!

Wonderful place for spend time with family and friends and fabulous food everything is amazing I enjoy my time with my friend Sue we have wonderful day and people who work in is very friendly and cooool very lovely God Bless you all 💗🤗🥂🍾🙏💯💪💪💪💪🇮🇹🍷👍👍👍👍💯🍷🇮🇹💪
Feel like home environment and outstanding home made food, great spot to eat while you're near the Botanical Gardens, just saying.
Mediocre at best
Best pizza

I don't do five star reviews, but the pizza, the service and the ambiance here - on a take out order during a global pandemic- was phenomenal. Sal is a true gentleman. The pizza is phenomenal. Can't wait to go back.
good location! The owner is great!
nice environment for a good slice
You won't find a better pica place in the area. Amazing service and even more amazing food. Hoghly recommend it.

This was the best family pizza experience I've ever had. The owner Sal opened up 15 minutes early for us because we were waiting with 4 kids 4 and under. He have them each pizza dough to play with and showed them how to make pizza. Our food was as fresh as it can be and then out of no where Sal came out okaying a saxphone with a giant sparkler in it. My kids loved every second of it. The best service I've ever had.

We like a lot going out. Yesterday we went to this delicious place which friends told us about. We passed a lovely experience there with fine meal and a nice stuff and  a professional  chef. We  added this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we shall definitely visit again very soon. We warmly recommend.
Pugsley's is one of the best in the bronx
Good pizza

So good to see Sal still working here. He's an institution as much as Fordham. Food is just as good as I remember. Chicken rolls are amazing as well as the slices. Can't go wrong here.
My friend like jumped behind the counter and was ringing the bell like a captain abord a ship. i will say their garlic knots are top notch!
What a pizza restaurant 😁 very recommanded!
Best pizza in the bronx  hands down
The best in the Italian neitbohoot
Cool

I have lived in New York for 5 years and this was one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had in the city. When we came in, there was no one in line, so we went right up to the counter to order... and stood there for 5 minutes waiting while no one said anything to us. When our order was finally taken, they got my nephew's order right but mine wrong. When they handed us our pizzas and garlic knots (which in fairness, were tasty), the woman tallied our total at $11 and then... walked away with no explanation. I waited another 3 minutes but no one came back to receive payment. I asked another man behind the counter how to pay, but he acted like he didn't hear me even though I was two feet from him. So I thought, "I guess you pay at the end like at a sit down restaurant." I took my pizza, went and sat down, took two bites, and then the same guy, who had just barely ignored me, shouted to me that I had to come back and pay. When I came back, he acted annoyed as if I had tried to eat without paying. As I was paying, my nephew asked for napkins, and again, the guy acted like he didn't hear him. I finished paying and he turned and started walking away, so I said, "excuse me, we asked for napkins." He grunted, turned back around, rolled his eyes, grabbed a few napkins from behind the counter, and slammed them on the counter as if this was the the most obnoxious thing a guest could ask for. Finally, we were able to eat our pizza in peace.  Tl;dr: The pizza is pretty good and the college ambience fun, but if you can't deliver one single basic customer service essential, you get one star.
The pie, the hospitality, the experience: simply AMAZING!!!
Very delicious
One of the few pizzreas that I will go out of my way to get to. Great taste, great value, great atmosphere. They are open late, they have alcohol and take cards.

Awesome slices. Late hours.  Food quality is very good here, flavorful as well.  Chicken bacon ranch slice is outstanding especially with some garlic powder.  Prices are food, cheaper with cash thn credit card $10 min on card. ATM on premises.
Loved the old style decor. Very homey feeling.
(Translated by Google) Vodka peel we have pizza .. Nuff said.  (Original) Pêne à la vodka on a pizza.. Nuff said.
Awesome spot! Great people who love what they're doing
The owner is crazy awesome!!!

I admire this place! They serve good meals, they have a nice menu, The cook in that restaurant is a professional, I love very much eating all their food. The food is consistently good, the attitude towards the visitors  is efficient. I often go to  this restaurant and I not even once was discontended. I recommend it with no hesitation.

This Hidden Gem of a Pizza shop is located between Fordham University & Fordham Rd and boy what an at home warm feeling when you enter, Sal welcomes you like he's know you for years and if your lucky he'll let you hit the Gong behind the Counter. Great Pizza and Food in General, staff is amazing. If your in the area its def worth a visit, and most of all don't forget to bring your appetite...
Super nice owner and great pizza!
Pugsleys is delicious and the environment is really good. If it ever goes out of business I will be devastated.
Felt welcomed, pizza was good but the price was a little high (3.00 per slice)

Great pizza and other Italian specialties made with LOVE. Sal makes you feel at home. Treats children special and makes them laugh. Decor is flashback 80's but you've got to respect a place with a gong behind the counter. Besides, you're not there for the decor: eat the pizza!
The pizza and other food is dynamite! Sal and family make it with love. Keep playing the sax Sal.

Saw pictures and reviews of this place and it all looked so great. I ordered a large thin crust with extra cheese and got a doughy thick pie with barely any cheese. Pizza was mediocre. Not worth the hype. "Best hidden pizzeria"?? I'm sorry but it should stay hidden.
A +
I grew up with these guys. Best pizza then and greatest pizza now.
Great prices, great service, great food. Whats not 2 love?

One of the best pizzerias in NYC, combines great pizza with delightful atmosphere. If you're lucky, Sal will play his sax for you. (If you're unlucky, you'll have the life scared out of you by the gong....)
The owner is adorable and the place is very inviting. Good pizza too!

How lucky I was to be there by chance! The owner was very cheerful, and kind even to invite me and my granddaughter in making Pizza. All of my family enjoyed the experiences and ,of course, nice Pizza too.
Amazing pizza and the owners are awesome. It was a great experience!

Disclaimer: I'm rating only the pizza. Without a doubt, the best traditional NY slice I've tried! Creamy and delicious. I can tell they use fresh cheese and they care about the making. Also tried the meat lovers but didn't like it as much as the simple cheese one. The place can use a little cleaning, but other than that, the guys are super nice and have a nice selections of condiments.
Might just have been the best slice of pizza I have ever had growing up in NY. From the sauce to the dough.  Everything was amazing!
The best hidden pizzeria.
Pugsley's is a piece of Fordham history! Nostalgia to the max and the sweetest staff

Excellent and delicious food made with true love. A place to go and will absolutely enjoy. I love Pugsley Pizza!!! 😍😍 You have to try! Will be back for more!

Wow! A super find, one of the most unforgettable pizza experiences. Sal and Pina are a wonderful couple and make you feel right at home. And the pizza is wonderful. Would give six stars if I could!

If you are looking for an authentic, Italian, New York pizza experience, you just can’t go wrong with Pugsley.  The slices are generous, the homemade sauce delicious, and the crust divine.  We recently stumbled across Pugsley and we will definitely be going back the next time we are in the Bronx.

I discovered this place at the first annual pizza festival, there in the Bronx and, out of the 25+ different pizzerias participating, this was one of my favorites. Since then, I went to the actual restaurant to pick up a pie and met the owner Sal. He and his wife were incredibly nice and the place had a really cool college hang-out vibe to it. Once again, the pizza surpassed our expectations. My wife and I have found our new favorite place.

So. Damn. Good. Authentic Italian pizza from two lovely Italians! The sauce is delicious. They make their own spicy sauce that goes over the top which makes it so good it hurts (if you're into spicy).

Pugsley's Pizza is a Bronx hidden gem! The owner and his family are so warm and welcoming.  Let's not forget that the food is delicious! It has that favorite college main stay regardless of your age. If you are ever in the area stop by and just experience it for yourself.
Overpriced

Delicious pizza with an old school vibe.

This is the most amazing pizza shop you can ever go to family oriented they treat you like one of their own😋💋

One of the few Mom and Pops restaurants in the Bronx and still open because it's the best. This is really a Fordham college secret because it's a little hidden restaurant behind Fordham road and in front of Fordham college but many people know about it.  Family owned and family friendly you'll get a loving feeling from this place and you'll feel like family once they start singing to you and invite you to the kitchen to hit the Gong for all to hear. This place is protected so don't think of coming here to get stupid because the community here will not allow anyone to get out of control here. 5 stars from me.

First time visiting this restaurant.   Pleasantly surprised.  Small in capacity with a very unique setting.  Great staff.   I had a super-sized, mouthwatering, scrumptious, melt-in-your-mouth pizza with extra cheese and sausage.  It was g-r-e-a-t!  Good food at low prices.  Well worth visiting.
Great eats. Good times. Love dis place

Great atmosphere and very friendly owner, with most importantly amazing pizza!
Heard about this place from friends. Food was good. But get it to go. Interior was something from many years ago. Very hidden location.

Excellent pizza. Been going there for years and I live about 15 miles from there. Plus they are open till 4am for the late nights when you are out with friends and need to get something to eat and a good price.
Great pizza
Overpriced

A Bronx/Fordham community institution for more than 30 years. Great pizza, pasta and sandwiches for reasonable prices.

(Translated by Google) Not expensive, but we know why. Not amazing pizza and really amazing filthy restaurant outside and inside.  (Original) Pas cher, mais on sait pourquoi. Pizza pas incroyable et restaurant d’une saleté vraiment incroyable à l’extérieur et à l’intérieur.

My daughter’s 7th birthday was celebrated at the Bronx Zoo and Pugsley’s Pizza catered it. It was PERFECT. This is an authentic Italian family owned business. Even though they open at 2 pm on Sundays, they accommodated us and had the food ready at 11:15. Sal and his son went above and beyond. They surprised me with special breadsticks shaped in my daughter’s name and the number 7 too. It was a great experience and I strongly recommend anytime.

"They really make you feel like your part of family everytime I come around" 😊 Good Stuff. *Try the Baked Ziti Pizza, its Magical" Kudos to Sal, Peter and the entire staff @PugsleyPizza

How could you not love this place? Love is it! If you are a first-timer, make sure to look up at the counter to find the specials.

You will be happier having eaten here!  Sal has created here a warm cozy atmosphere that is as amazing as you allow it to be. His menu only offers what he loves to make. Food for him is an expression of love; his words.  Of course the Fordham brand is represented. During the school year the hours are 11am-5am, Summer hours are 11am-7pm.  The entrance is out of the way, as it should be. Finding it is a reward for your effort.  Only bring fun, creative people here!
I just had the best pizza I ever had in my life
The best pizza in the Bronx!!! Sal and famiglia are awesome!!!

Pugsley Pizza is one of my favorite pizzerias in the Bronx. Not only is the pizza completely authentic and incredibly delicious, but the atmosphere and interior of the place are quirky, thematic and fun. The place is frequented mainly by Fordham University students. If ever in the area, you must stray off of Fordham Rd and into this pizzeria.
Sal is the man..! Awesome pizza !!!!

What hasn't been said about Pugsley's? It's an experience. Whether you're a Fordham student, alum, or someone who got lost on their way to Arthur Avenue, this place has something for everyone. My pick: the Rich Special

food is solid. Sal is basically my father reincarnated. definitely a place to bring the ladies, that is if you expect to fight with your lady in public and would need some assistance in the form of some chicken rolls and melty mozzarella sticks as projectiles. borderline trauma aside, Pugsley's offers a quaint, quirky Mom & Pop (or should I say Mom & Sal) pizza resource, complete with fuzzy seating.
Have you ever had a chicken roll? Try it here because it's good. So good.
Love is it. A must attend pizza place with an interesting and kind cast of characters, and delicious pizza to boot.
Pugsley is a great local place for pizza and is the go to pizza place for Fordham University students. I love their chicken rolls as well as their pizza.
Good pizza, very friendly atmosphere with a touch of Italian.
Small dive pizza store tucked away from the main street.  The owner is super friendly, and food is pretty good as well!

To call this a pizza joint is not enough. It's a place to sit and relax and pretty much unwind.  The culmination of random furniture and fixtures would make you think it has an identity crisis but it works in this case.  Food isn't bad. I like the Parmesan chicken and the sauce on the pizza isn't bad.  I would come here for the company and the feel more than for the food. Food is a plus. Staff is friendly and the crowd it attracts is the same.
The number #1 -best pizza in the Bronx
Best chicken parm sandwiches ever
How this place has anything less than five stars is beyond me. Sal makes incredibly delicious stuff, his restaurant is quirky and great, Pugsley's is fantastic.

It's a Fordham University staple - open late and quick delivery, but nothing special. I hope you like your food with oil because they put extra on the garlic knots and chicken rolls, among other things. Not the way I normally eat my food, but it's one of the few places open at 3 am when you need something to sustain you while writing a paper.
If you're not a drunk college undergraduate looking for a place to drink illegally, don't bother going here.
